Author: Kitchen Table#2858
Content: I really don't count that dump since it was done by the hacker which found a bug to create as many coins as he wanted in the komodo wallet. He was in a rush to sell them on the only "trusted" exchange that didn't turn off trading because the exchange was a two man operation and they don't work on the weekends.

Content:
`I don‚Äôt see a komodillionaire destroying their own value by overwhelming orderbooks`
While I was using a bit of hyperbole and 'poetic license'; the fact remains that if you have 1M and the price you liquidate at is only 25 cents higher, it's still a $250k profit and in the tens of millions if you bought at $1 and dump from $50 back to $1
Scale matters

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: with only 3 nodes, its just better to everyone delete everything and try again

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: the best method to not get a fork at the very early stages is to start the 2 nodes without mining and then do ./komodo-cli -ac_name=LIZ setgenerate true 1

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: that way one node will start mining only

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: if you want to connect other nodes, do so without mining (-gen parameter)

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: @Hollowman9000

Author: Hollowman9000#3344
Content: What‚Äôs difference between 3 and 1000

Author: Hollowman9000#3344
Content: You‚Äôll still need conflict resolution

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: when you have 1000 its easier for the chain to find a consensus on which has the longest chain

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: with only 3 nodes of relative similar cpu power, youll get confusion if everyone is mining at the same time

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: blockchains are very very delicate when they are born

Content: Many people who have gotten into this space don't have the knowhow let alone the patience to learn to install run and maintain a full node .  I know it's sad but in terms of adoption trends as cryptocurrency continues to grow less and less technically inclined folks will join

Content: I've had to help with dozens of lite client wallet installs because people were getting confused ,  if they are getting confused with that they will definitely be confused running a full node.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: The larger picture here is that the more daemon/wallet/whatever brands that exist is the less control they have over the process and the more possible is could be to decentralize the code at some future point.
